TEI.2.document_title: Samuel Norris to Stephen F. Austin, 06-24-1824

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 841

div1.p: Sir since I came from Atoscoeete a Mr McCoy has applyed to me for justice wishing me to make those French jentlemen pay him his wages having turned him [off] without any reason, only his not being able to attend to his business one day they are so far advanced on their road and he is going into your Colony I wish you to give him a fair tryal he has his witnesses with the waggons if he applys for it.
